line.originaltext: 1 pound ground pork
4 cups shredded cabbage
1 large carrot, shredded
1/2 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips
line.annotation: create_ing(ing3, "1/2 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips")

line.originaltext: 1 medium onion, chopped
3 cloves garlic, minced
3 teaspoons fresh ginger root, grated
line.annotation: create_ing(ing6, "3 teaspoons fresh ginger root, grated")

line.originaltext: 1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 1/2 tablespoons molasses
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 quart oil for frying
1 1/2 (14 ounce) packages egg roll wrappers
line.annotation: create_ing(ing12, "1 1/2 (14 ounce) packages egg roll wrappers")

line.originaltext: 1 1/2 cups sweet and sour sauce
line.annotation: create_ing(ing13, "1 1/2 cups sweet and sour sauce")

line.originaltext: Cook pork in a large wok over medium-high heat.
Cook pork in a large wok over medium-high heat.
Drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, mix the cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, onion, garlic and ginger.
In a large bowl, mix the cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, onion, garlic and ginger.
line.annotation: combine({ing1, ing2, ing3, ing4, ing5, ing6}, ing16, "veggies", "")

line.originaltext: In a large bowl, mix the cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, onion, garlic and ginger.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch, soy sauce, and molasses until smooth.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch, soy sauce, and molasses until smooth.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch, soy sauce, and molasses until smooth.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch, soy sauce, and molasses until smooth.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in wok.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in wok.
Stir in cabbage mixture in batches, cooking each batch 3 to 4 minutes, just until tender.
line.annotation: combine({ing17, ing20}, ing21, "oiled cabbage mixture", "stir in cabbage in batches")

line.originaltext: Stir in cabbage mixture in batches, cooking each batch 3 to 4 minutes, just until tender.
line.annotation: cook(ing21, t0, ing22, "cooked cabbage", "cook each batch 3-4 minutes")

line.originaltext: Stir in cabbage mixture in batches, cooking each batch 3 to 4 minutes, just until tender.
Return vegetables to bowl, and mix in pork.
Return vegetables to bowl, and mix in pork.
line.annotation: combine({ing15, ing22}, ing23, "pork and cabbage", "mix in pork")

line.originaltext: Stir in the cornstarch mixture.
line.annotation: combine({ing19, ing23}, ing24, "stuff in bowl", "stir in cornstarch mixture")

line.originaltext: Heat 1 quart oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C).
Heat 1 quart oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C).
line.annotation: cook(ing11, t3, ing25, "frying oil", "heat to 365 degrees")

line.originaltext: Place about 1 tablespoon filling on each egg roll wrapper.
line.annotation: combine({ing12, ing24}, ing26, "unwrapped rolls", "put 1 tablespoon filling in each egg roll wrapper")

line.originaltext: Fold one corner of wrapper over filling.
line.annotation: do(ing26, , ing27, "corner folded wrapper", "fold one corner of wrapper over filling")

line.originaltext: Fold wrapper sides over filling.
line.annotation: do(ing27, , ing28, "sides folded rolls", "fold wrapper sides over filling")

line.originaltext: Roll wrappers to form egg rolls.
Fry egg rolls in batches in the hot oil until golden brown.
Fry egg rolls in batches in the hot oil until golden brown.
line.annotation: cook(ing30, t3, ing31, "fried rolls", "fry rolls in oil")

line.originaltext: Fry egg rolls in batches in the hot oil until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour sauce.
Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour sauce.
line.annotation: do(ing31, t4, ing32, "drained rolls", "drain rolls on towels")

line.originaltext: Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour sauce.
line.annotation: combine({ing13, ing32}, ing33, "final egg rolls", "use sauce to taste")

line.originaltext: Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour sauce.
line.annotation: serve(ing33,"serve with sweet and sour sauce")
